meanings.definition: A branch or lateral shoot from a main stem or trunk of a plant.
meanings.sent1: The tiny offshoot of the tree was just starting to grow.
meanings.sent2: The gardener trimmed the offshoot to encourage new growth.
meanings.sent3: The offshoot of the plant seemed to wave hello in the breeze.
meanings.sent4: The offshoot reached out like a curious child exploring the world.
meanings.sent5: The offshoot's green leaves sparkled in the sunlight, catching everyone's eye.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that is a direct result of or grows from something else.
meanings.sent1: The new company was an offshoot of the original business.
meanings.sent2: Her success was an offshoot of her hard work and dedication.
meanings.sent3: The offshoot of the project surprised everyone with its creativity.
meanings.sent4: His idea was an offshoot of a conversation he overheard at the cafe.
meanings.sent5: The offshoot of their friendship blossomed into a strong bond over time.

meanings.definition: A subdivision or subsidiary part of a larger organization or group.
meanings.sent1: The local branch was an offshoot of the national organization.
meanings.sent2: The offshoot of the club focused on community service projects.
meanings.sent3: The offshoot of the team had a unique logo that stood out.
meanings.sent4: The offshoot of the company specialized in eco-friendly products.
meanings.sent5: The offshoot of the group brought fresh ideas to the table during meetings.
